creator: bogdan.maris@softvision.ro
summary: Extra area in Privacy Panel when visiting the Tracking Protection tour and TP is toggled on and off

assigned_to_detail.name: nobody@mozilla.org
assigned_to_detail.real_name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

comments.text:
[Affected versions]:
- Nightly 62.0a1

[Affected platforms]:
- macOS 10.13.5
- Ubuntu 18.04
- Windows 10 64bit

[Steps to reproduce]:
1. Open Firefox
2. Visit the following URL: https://www.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/62.0a1/tracking-protection/start/?step=1
3. Follow the steps until reaching step 3 of 3 
4. Click > icon (Show connection details)
5. Turn off Tracking Protection from Hamburger Menu
6. Click < icon to go back to Privacy Panel

[Expected result]:
- Privacy Panel has no visual defects.

[Actual result]:
- Extra area is shown under Clear Cookies and Site Data...

[Regression range]:
- Not a regression since its also reproducible on the build where this was introduced, Nightly 2018-06-01

[Additional notes]:
- Here is a screencast showing the issue: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1lhu72OO2j4LkFImKM63_-gUgQA1-c8uh (the screencast was made on ubuntu, .mp4 file and it would not work if I would have added it to bugzilla directly).
comments.author: bogdan.maris@softvision.ro

comments.text: This should have gotten fixed by bug 1462470 (because we're now always showing the tracking protection section). Would you like to verify and close this?
comments.author: jhofmann@mozilla.com

comments.text: Issue still reproduces after bug 1462470, but a little different: https://drive.google.com/open?id=1hVXN8-udeCXqy8XqjIVhgrJexPfm4jWE
comments.author: bogdan.maris@softvision.ro

comments.text: Yeah, there's a general problem with popup resizing but it's probably fine to track this individually.
comments.author: jhofmann@mozilla.com

comments.text: I just realized you have to be in the TP tour for this to happen (because you can't have both popups open at the same time normally), so this is rather a P5.
